comments.body: haha wow this is going to be *super* annoying for anybody who turns on checkJS and then uses `assert` from `@types/node`. Hope this is only with strictNullChecks on.

later: no this is a bug when importing assertions via commonjs.

Filed https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript/issues/38379 to track it.

comments.body:
No more implicit any when indexing never (repros in ts too):

```ts
function f(l: never, x: any) {
  var x = l[0] // should be implicit any error here
  x.length  // and no error here
}
```

With noImplicitAny on, you should get a noImplicitAny error, and instead you get an error on the next line that 'length' does not exist on type 'never'.

Filed #26493
Intended effect of https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/pull/26340

comments.body: `document.body: HTMLElement | null`. Was it just `HTMLElement` before?
Yea.

After discussion with @weswigham and @rbuckton, we are pretty sure that this should still be `HTMLElement`. `HTMLElement | null`is even more pedantic than making array indexing nullable. I'll file an issue on TSJS-libgenerator to track this fix.

@andy-ms once that fix is in, all the changes you had to make to DefinitelyTyped will be obsolete, sorry. :(
Filed issue Microsoft/TSJS-lib-generator#558
